p: In the MONSU simulation system, climate change impacts on productivity were simulated by adjusting species- and site-specific growth functions with data from simulations by a physiological model ( Pukkala and Kellomaki 2012). Under a changing climate, the probability of wind damage was expected to increase by 0.17% per year to account for an increase of the unfrozen soil period ( Kellom√§ki et al 2010 ), but no change in wind climate was assumed ( Gregow 2013). Productivity changes alter the dominance of different tree species, stocking (stand density), height and height/diameter ratio of trees all of which affect the critical values of wind speed that determine wind damage.
